item.title: 2025 ECAC Esports Spring Showdown | April 4–6
item.description: April 4–6, 2025 | The ECAC Esports Spring Showdown will bring collegiate gaming teams from around the country to the university’s Curtis R. Priem Experimental and Performing Arts Center. The teams will compete in several esports titles, including Rocket League and Overwatch. Bringing in over 125 schools and 800 student teams, the event is reportedly expected to draw in thousands of participants and spectators to Troy.

item.title: STS Colloquium presents Dr. Sara Black, “Grow food, not prisons!” Innocence and abolition in rural New York
item.description: Drawing on over 10 years of organizing and scholarship at the intersections of struggles over food, housing, and incarceration in New York, this research presentation mobilizes the concept of “abolition geography” (Gilmore 2023) as an antidote to agendas structured in agrarian innocence. This talk will be held on March 19, at 1pm in Sage 5711.

item.description: Please join us in the CBIS Auditorium from 9am to 5:30pm for a lecture and panel discussion with media theorist Jussi Parikka (Aarhus University) in conversation with art historian/theorist Caroline A. item.title: My Town: Jack Fever’s newest work with filmmaker Jeremy Jacob | March 21
item.description: Date: Friday, March 21, 2025 7:00 PM - One night only! In the world premiere of their tour de force, MY TOWN, Jack Ferver delivers a high voltage performance of exacting physical and psychological choreography. Housed within a complex and mysterious multimedia design by acclaimed artist Jeremy Jacob, the evening-length solo queers Thornton Wilder’s 1938 American classic, Our Town. Moving through tragicomic moments of violence, sexuality, and loss, this work is for mature audiences.
